item.title: When Flat Rate Movers Won't Answer Your Calls
item.description: Back in 2023 I went through an inter-state move with Flat Rate Movers, LTD. (US DOT 488466, MC 254356). They bungled the job, damaged my stuff and my house, and then refused to talk to me or their own insurance company. I placed dozens of calls, wrote letters, emails, nothing worked. I finally got some money for the damage by working with their insurer directly. I know a lot of folks struggle with moving companies, and figured I‚Äôd write up a bit of this story in case it helps. You can skip ahead if you just want to know about the FMCSA insurer database.

item.title: Passwords are okay, impulsive Internet isn't
item.description: Article discussing the push for passkeys as an alternative to passwords, including numerous problems associated with passkeys like big companies agenda, complicated proprietary implementations, vendor lock-in requirements and dependency on smartphones, dubious value for ordinary users, and misplaced purpose and value, hype and security, lax IT practices and constant private data leaks, psychological reasons why modern Web and email are interactive and phishing-prone due to profit-driven design, wrongness of clickable links, practice of information-only communication, severe implications for privacy and freedom in so-called modern solutions, some other observations, and more

item.title: ARK001: Building ARK RESTful API
item.description:
In this video, we walk through how to build a complete RESTful API for Project ARK ‚Äî from clean architecture and service orchestration to database integration and automated testing. You'll see how to implement a scalable, maintainable API using modern .NET practices and set up CI/CD pipelines to ensure quality and reliability at every stage of delivery.
üîß What You'll Learn:
Structuring your API using The Standard (The Project, The Team, The Product)
Creating controllers, services, interfaces, and repositories
Writing unit and integration tests with mocking
Setting up GitHub Actions (or Azure DevOps) pipelines for automated build, test, and deployment
Applying security best practices and versioning your API
Deploying to cloud (optional: Azure Web App)
Whether you're a beginner looking to learn proper REST API practices or an experienced engineer aiming to refine your architecture and DevOps process, this is your complete guide.
üì¶ Tech Stack: C# .NET | Entity Framework | SQL Server | GitHub Actions | Docker | Azure
üß± Based on principles from The Standard by Hassan Habib

item.title: Engineering Management Is Being Gatekept?! - Engineering Manager AMA
item.description:
So you're interested in heading down the people management path in an engineering manager role? Well...
You won't like it. It's sooooo much work. Trust me, you'd be better at something else. We'll talk about it when you're a senior or principal.
Does any of that sound familiar? Why the HECK are managers gatekeeping the EM role?! Let's talk about it.
As with all livestreams, I'm looking forward to answering YOUR questions! So join me live and ask in the chat, or you can comment now and I can try to get it answered while I stream.
